intro: Hieronyma antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian wax apple, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean region of Colombia, specifically the Antioquia Department. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, palmate leaves, and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a smooth, yellowish drupe that contains a single seed. Hieronyma antioquensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within montane forests.
